Confucius.name: Confucius
Confucius.profile: Confucius, a Chinese philosopher and founder of Confucianism

context.name: Confucius
context.Summary: Confucius was a Chinese philosopher of the Spring and Autumn period, traditionally regarded as the paragon of Chinese sages, whose ethical and political teachings formed the foundation of Confucianism and profoundly shaped East Asian cultural and social thought.

Qin Shi Huang.name: Qin Shi Huang
Qin Shi Huang.profile: Qin Shi Huang, the first emperor of unified China

context.name: Qin Shi Huang
context.Summary: Qin Shi Huang, born in 259 BC, was the first emperor of China, known for unifying the country, standardizing measurements, and constructing the Great Wall, but also criticized for his tyrannical rule and cultural suppression.

Fan Bingbing.name: Fan Bingbing
Fan Bingbing.profile: Fan Bingbing, a famous Chinese actress and singer

context.name: Fan Bingbing
context.Summary: Fan Bingbing, born in 1981, is a Chinese actress, model, television producer, and singer who gained fame for her role in the drama 'My Fair Princess' and faced tax evasion allegations in 2018, resulting in a significant fine and public apology.

Leslie Cheung.name: Leslie Cheung
Leslie Cheung.profile: Leslie Cheung, Hong Kong singer and actor

context.name: Leslie Cheung
context.Summary: Leslie Cheung was a Hong Kong singer and actor, celebrated as one of the founding fathers of Cantopop and one of the Chinese world’s most influential cultural icons, renowned for his debonair persona, flamboyant screen characters, and avant-garde, androgynous stage presence.

Lin Daiyu.name: Lin Daiyu
Lin Daiyu.profile: Lin Daiyu, a tragic heroine from Dream of the Red Chamber

context.name: Lin Daiyu
context.Summary: Lin Daiyu is a character who is the female protagonist in a story featuring the nobleman Ga Bo-ok, who is part of a high-class family and is involved in a love triangle with Lin Daiyu and Seol Bo-chae.

Cheng Dieyi.name: Cheng Dieyi
Cheng Dieyi.profile: Cheng Dieyi, a Peking opera performer in Farewell My Concubine

context.name: Cheng Dieyi
context.Summary: Cheng Dieyi was a famous Peking opera actor during the Japanese invasion of China in 1937, who became envious of his colleague Dan Shalu's relationship with a renowned courtesan, leading him to rely on a wealthy patron and eventually succumb to opium addiction due to feelings of betrayal.

Li Xiao-Jun.name: Li Xiao-Jun
Li Xiao-Jun.profile: Li Xiao-Jun, a young man in Comrades: Almost a Love Story

context.name: Li Xiao-Jun
context.Summary: Li Xiao-Jun is a naive northerner from Mainland China who moves to Hong Kong to make a living, falls in love with Li Qiao but parts ways over conflicting ambitions, and reunites with her in the United States almost ten years later.

Ye Xianglun.name: Ye Xianglun
Ye Xianglun.profile: Ye Xianglun, a character from the drama Secret

context.name: Ye Xianglun
context.Summary: Ye Xianglun is an arts high school student majoring in piano who lives with his father.

William Shakespeare.name: William Shakespeare
William Shakespeare.profile: William Shakespeare, a renowned English playwright and poet

context.name: William Shakespeare
context.Summary: William Shakespeare was an English playwright and poet born in 1564, renowned for his profound insights into human nature and his enduring works such as 'Romeo and Juliet' and 'Hamlet', despite not having received a university education.

Queen Victoria.name: Queen Victoria
Queen Victoria.profile: Queen Victoria, the long-reigning monarch of the United Kingdom

context.name: Queen Victoria
context.Summary: Queen Victoria, born in 1819, was the Queen of the United Kingdom from 1837 to 1901, known for her long reign during the Victorian era, which marked the height of the British Empire, and she was often referred to as the 'Grandmother of Europe' due to her children's marriages into various European royal families.

Emma Watson.name: Emma Watson
Emma Watson.profile: Emma Watson, a British actress known for her role as Hermione Granger

context.name: Emma Watson
context.Summary: Emma Watson is a renowned actress best known for her role as Hermione Granger in the Harry Potter series, and she has also been active as a model, fashion consultant, and UN Women Goodwill Ambassador.

Steve Jobs.name: Steve Jobs
Steve Jobs.profile: Steve Jobs, co-founder of Apple and pioneer of the personal computer

context.name: Steve Jobs
context.Summary: Steve Jobs, born in 1955, was an influential American entrepreneur, co-founder and former CEO of Apple, known for revolutionizing the personal computer, music, and smartphone industries, and was also a major shareholder and board member of Disney through his ownership of Pixar.

Sherlock Holmes.name: Sherlock Holmes
Sherlock Holmes.profile: Sherlock Holmes, a fictional detective created by Arthur Conan Doyle

context.name: Sherlock Holmes
context.Summary: Sherlock Holmes is a fictional detective created by Arthur Conan Doyle, known for his keen observation and deductive skills, who operates in late 19th and early 20th century England and remains a popular character worldwide.

Sherlock Holmes.media: detective novel by British writer Arthur Conan Doyle

Rocky Balboa.name: Rocky Balboa
Rocky Balboa.profile: Rocky Balboa, a fictional boxer from the film series Rocky

context.name: Rocky Balboa
context.Summary: Rocky Balboa is a fictional Italian-American boxer from Philadelphia, created and portrayed by Sylvester Stallone, known for overcoming personal and professional challenges in the Rocky film franchise.

Sarah.name: Sarah
Sarah.profile: Sarah, a curious girl from the animated series Sarah & Duck

context.name: Sarah
context.Summary: Sarah is a kind and polite seven-year-old girl who embarks on imaginative adventures with her best friend, Duck, in the animated series 'Sarah and Duck', which focuses on themes of friendship, imagination, and problem-solving.

Beth Harmon.name: Beth Harmon
Beth Harmon.profile: Beth Harmon, a chess prodigy from the drama The Queen's Gambit

context.name: Beth Harmon
context.Summary: Beth Harmon is a fictional American chess prodigy who, after being orphaned and taught chess in a Kentucky orphanage, rises to challenge top Soviet players while battling addiction to tranquilizers and alcohol.

Oh Ae-sun.name: Oh Ae-sun
Oh Ae-sun.profile: Oh Ae-sun from the Netflix drama When Life Gives You Tangerines

context.name: Oh Ae-sun
context.Summary: Oh Ae-sun is a resilient Jeju poet whose indomitable spirit sustains her through orphanhood, tragedy, and poverty, earning her community’s love and culminating in the late-life publication of her own poetry collection.

Lee Gi-yeong.name: Lee Gi-yeong
Lee Gi-yeong.profile: Gi-yeong Lee, a character from the Korean comic Black Rubber Shoes

context.name: Lee Gi-yeong
context.Summary: Lee Gi-yeong is the mischievous yet kind-hearted elementary school protagonist of the Korean comic and animated series “Black Rubber Shoes,” known for his academic talent, adventurous spirit, and eventual growth into a swordmaster.

Sejong.name: Sejong
Sejong.profile: King Sejong the Great, a historical figure from Korea

context.name: Sejong
context.Summary: Sejong, born in 1397, was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty in Korea, renowned for his contributions to science, culture, and governance, including the creation of the Korean script Hangul, and is often referred to as 'Sejong the Great' in recognition of his achievements.

Son Heung-min.name: Son Heung-min
Son Heung-min.profile: Son Heung-min, a South Korean football player

context.name: Son Heung-min
context.Summary: Son Heung-min is a South Korean professional footballer known for his exceptional skills and versatility on the field.

context.name: Faker
context.Summary: Faker, whose real name is Lee Sang-hyeok, born in 1996, is a South Korean professional League of Legends player known for his role as a mid laner for T1, with multiple championship titles including five World Championships and two Mid-Season Invitational victories.

context.name: Hana
context.Summary: Hana is an elementary school student living in a peaceful city, who, along with her twin, discovers their father has been kidnapped and decides to rescue him with the help of a transforming robot named Tobot.

Yi Sun-sin.name: Yi Sun-sin
Yi Sun-sin.profile: Yi Sun-sin, the great Korean man

context.name: Yi Sun-sin
context.Summary: Yi Sun-sin was a distinguished Korean naval commander born in 1545, renowned for his leadership and strategic prowess during the Imjin War, where he achieved numerous victories against the Japanese navy, ultimately sacrificing his life in the Battle of Noryang.

context.name: Heungbu
context.Summary: Heungbu is a character from the Korean classic novel 'Heungbujeon', known for his kindness and misfortune, who ultimately receives unexpected fortune after helping an injured swallow, embodying the theme of 'good triumphs over evil'.

José María Morelos.name: José María Morelos
José María Morelos.profile: José María Morelos, a Mexican independence leader and priest

context.name: José María Morelos
context.Summary: José María Morelos was a Mexican Catholic priest and revolutionary leader who played a crucial role in the Mexican War of Independence, leading the movement after Miguel Hidalgo's execution and significantly contributing to the fight against Spanish rule until his capture and execution in 1815.

Benito Juárez.name: Benito Juárez
Benito Juárez.profile: Benito Juárez, a Mexican president known for his liberal reforms

context.name: Benito Juárez
context.Summary: Benito Juárez, born in 1806, was a Mexican politician and the first Indigenous president of Mexico, known for leading the country through the Reform War and the Second French intervention, and for his significant contributions to liberal politics and law in Mexico.

Salma Hayek.name: Salma Hayek
Salma Hayek.profile: Salma Hayek, a Mexican-American actress and film producer

context.name: Salma Hayek
context.Summary: Salma Hayek is a Mexican and American actress and film producer known for her roles in films like Frida, Desperado, and Eternals, and for being the first Mexican actress nominated for the Academy Award for Best Actress.

Eiza González.name: Eiza González
Eiza González.profile: Eiza González, a Mexican actress and singer

context.name: Eiza González
context.Summary: Eiza González, born in 1990, is a Mexican actress and singer known for her roles in the teen telenovela Sueña conmigo and films like Baby Driver and Alita: Battle Angel, as well as her music career with albums such as Contracorriente.

Chucho el Roto.name: Chucho el Roto
Chucho el Roto.profile: Chucho el Roto, a legendary Mexican bandit and folk hero

context.name: Chucho el Roto
context.Summary: Chucho el Roto, born Jesús Arriaga in 1858, was a Mexican bandit known for his Robin Hood-like exploits of robbing the wealthy and sharing with the poor, whose life inspired numerous books, plays, and media adaptations.

Clemencia.name: Clemencia
Clemencia.profile: Clemencia, the heroine of the novel Clemencia

context.name: Clemencia
context.Summary: Clemencia is a character from a Mexican novel written in 1869 by Ignacio Manuel Altamirano, set in 1863 during the Second French Intervention in Mexico.

La India María.name: La India María
La India María.profile: La India María, a comedic Indigenous character from Mexican film and TV

context.name: La India María
context.Summary: La India María is a fictional character created by María Elena Velasco, known for her comedic portrayal of an indigenous woman navigating and overcoming societal challenges such as discrimination and corruption, appearing in numerous films and television series over 30 years.

Renata.name: Renata
Renata.profile: Renata, a teenage girl from the Mexican film Amarte Duele

context.name: Renata
context.Summary: Renata is a young woman from a high social class who falls in love with a young man from a lower social class, leading to an impossible love due to their class differences.

Isabella I of Castile.name: Isabella I of Castile
Isabella I of Castile.profile: Isabel I, Queen of Castile who unified Spain with Ferdinand II

context.name: Isabella I of Castile
context.Summary: Isabella I of Castile, born in 1451, was the Queen of Castile from 1474 to 1504 and is known as Isabel la Católica, who, alongside her husband Fernando of Aragón, played a crucial role in the unification of Spain and the conquest of the Kingdom of Granada, earning the title of Reyes Católicos from Pope Alexander VI.

Miguel de Cervantes.name: Miguel de Cervantes
Miguel de Cervantes.profile: Miguel de Cervantes, Spanish novelist and author

context.name: Miguel de Cervantes
context.Summary: Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra was a Spanish writer renowned for his novel Don Quixote, considered the first modern novel and a central work in world literature, despite spending much of his life in poverty and obscurity.

Salvador Dalí.name: Salvador Dalí
Salvador Dalí.profile: Salvador Dalí, a surrealist Spanish painter and cultural icon

context.name: Salvador Dalí
context.Summary: Salvador Dalí was a Spanish surrealist artist known for his technical skill and bizarre imagery, who became a leading figure in the Surrealist movement and explored themes such as dreams, the subconscious, and science in his diverse artistic works.

Mario Casas.name: Mario Casas
Mario Casas.profile: Mario Casas, a popular Spanish film and television actor

context.name: Mario Casas
context.Summary: Mario Casas is a Spanish actor born in 1986, known for his roles in both Spanish cinema and television, and has received several awards including a Goya Award.

Don Quixote.name: Don Quixote
Don Quixote.profile: Don Quixote, a fictional knight-errant from Cervantes' novel

context.name: Don Quixote
context.Summary: Don Quixote is a fictional nobleman from Miguel de Cervantes' novel who becomes a self-styled knight-errant, embarking on adventures with his squire Sancho Panza, and is known for his idealism and misadventures, such as mistaking windmills for giants.

Captain Alatriste.name: Captain Alatriste
Captain Alatriste.profile: Captain Alatriste, a fictional Spanish soldier and swordsma

context.name: Captain Alatriste
context.Summary: Diego Alatriste is a former soldier and contract killer in early 17th century Madrid, who becomes involved in international intrigues while caring for a fatherless boy named Iñigo Balboa.

Tokyo.name: Tokyo
Tokyo.profile: Tokyo, a main character and narrator in the series Money Heist

context.name: Tokyo
context.Summary: Tokyo is a rebellious and flirty thief involved in a heist of the Royal Mint in Madrid, recruited by the Professor, and known for her tumultuous relationship with Rio and friendship with Nairobi.

Julián Martínez.name: Julián Martínez
Julián Martínez.profile: Julián Martínez, a time-traveling agent in El ministerio del tiempo

context.name: Julián Martínez
context.Summary: Julián Martínez, nacido en 1975, es un personaje ficticio de la serie española 'El Ministerio del Tiempo', quien pasó de ser enfermero a agente del Ministerio tras un encuentro inusual con hombres disfrazados del siglo XIX durante un incendio.

Senapati of Mataram.name: Senapati of Mataram
Senapati of Mataram.profile: Senapati of Mataram, founder and first ruler of the Mataram Sultanate

context.name: Senapati of Mataram
context.Summary: Panembahan Senapati, born Danang Sutawijaya, was the founder of the Mataram Sultanate and succeeded his father as chief of Mataram after his father's death in 1575, playing a significant role in the region's history until his own death in 1601.

Diponegoro.name: Diponegoro
Diponegoro.profile: Diponegoro, Javanese prince and leader against Dutch colonial rule

context.name: Diponegoro
context.Summary: Prince Diponegoro, born in 1785, was a Javanese prince and national hero of Indonesia who led a significant resistance against Dutch colonial rule during the Java War from 1825 to 1830.

Sutan Sjahrir.name: Sutan Sjahrir
Sutan Sjahrir.profile: Sutan Sjahrir, Indonesia's first Prime Minister

context.name: Sutan Sjahrir
context.Summary: Sutan Sjahrir was an Indonesian statesman and the first prime minister of Indonesia, known for his role in the Indonesian National Revolution and his leadership in the nationalist movement, as well as founding the Indonesian Socialist Party to oppose the Communist Party.

Melati Suryodarmo.name: Melati Suryodarmo
Melati Suryodarmo.profile: Melati Suryodarmo, Indonesian durational performance artist

context.name: Melati Suryodarmo
context.Summary: Melati Suryodarmo is an Indonesian durational performance artist known for her physically demanding and repetitive performances, who has exhibited internationally and founded the Undisclosed Territory festival in Indonesia, and was the first female artistic director of the Jakarta Biennale.

Sandokan.name: Sandokan
Sandokan.profile: Sandokan, pirate from Emilio Salgari's novels

context.name: Sandokan
context.Summary: Sandokan is a fictional 19th-century pirate, known as the 'Tiger of Malaya', created by Italian author Emilio Salgari, who leads a group of rebels and pirates in adventures against colonial powers in the South China Sea and beyond.

Siti Akbari.name: Siti Akbari
Siti Akbari.profile: Siti Akbari, woman from the novel Sair Tjerita Siti Akbari

context.name: Siti Akbari
context.Summary: Siti Akbari is an 1884 Malay-language syair by Lie Kim Hok, notable for its suspenseful narrative and European literary influences, telling the story of a woman who disguises herself as a man to rescue her husband from captivity, and it remains a significant work in Chinese Malay literature despite criticisms of unoriginality.

Saman.name: Saman
Saman.profile: Saman, former priest from Ayu Utami's novel

context.name: Saman
context.Summary: Saman is a novel by Ayu Utami, published in 1998, that explores themes of sexuality, mysticism, and political authoritarianism through the lives of four women and a former priest, sparking a new literary movement in Indonesia.

context.name: Zainuddin
context.Summary: Zainuddin is a mixed-race character in the novel 'Tenggelamnja Kapal van der Wijck' by Hamka, which explores themes of love and societal discrimination in Minang society.
